Caption: Fig. 1. A screenshot of the BGPlay system showing the same AS-graph shown in Fig. 2(a).

Fig. 2. (a) A screenshot of the BGPlay system enhanced by the topographic map approach described in this paper. The AS that originates the preﬁx is 137, highlighted in red an indicated by an arrow. Our approach clearly shows the importance of the ASes traversed by paths ending into 137. (b), (c) An example of a real topographic map (courtesy of the U.S. GS).

Fig. 3. An handmade layered drawing showing the drawbacks of this kind of representation. Observe how paths zigzag while climbing and descending the hierarchy. Also, ASes that are very far in the network may be represented by nodes which are very near in the drawing (as the black and the gray nodes).

Fig. 4. Example of application of the algorithm. (a) Phase 1, the addition of the ﬁrst fence. (b) Phase 1, the addition of the second fence. (c) Phase 1, the addition of the fourth fence. (d) Final layout after Phase 2. The actual picture shown to the user is presented in Fig. 2(a).
Fig. 8. Density of CI1 (coastline indention of region 1). Augmenting the mobility factor progressively increases the indention of the border of region 1.
